discussion.content:
SNMPv2 introduced two features that provide the ability to retrieve large amounts of data in one request and acknowledge a trap using PDUs. These features are:

 GetBulkRequest: This feature allows a management station to retrieve a large amount of data in one request, reducing the number of requests needed to retrieve the same information. The GetBulkRequest PDU specifies a starting OID and a maximum number of variables to be returned in a single response.

 InformRequest: This feature is used to acknowledge receipt of a trap message from an agent. The InformRequest PDU is similar to the trap PDU, but it includes a request identifier, which allows the management station to match the acknowledgment with the original trap. The InformRequest also requires an acknowledgment from the receiving device, which provides greater reliability in trap delivery.

Selected Answer: DE
D & E are correct

Selected Answer: DE
Get, GetNext &Set are request types or operations in SNMPv1
SNMPv2 introduced two new commands: Getbulk & Inform

Selected Answer: DE
in order to retrieve Large amounts of data as stated in the question in regards to SNMP v2 is Get bulk message which is just a better version of Get next which is just used to gather information

The Inform Request feature is just used as an acknowledgment of trap messages

questions.question_text: Which two features introduced in SNMPv2 provide the ability to retrieve large amounts of data in one request and acknowledge a trap using PDUs? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Unique local addresses will begin with either FC or FD:

The first 7 bits indicate that we have a unique local address. 1111 110 in binary is FC in hexadecimal. However, the L bit (8th bit) has to be set to 1 so we end up with 1111 1101 which is FD in hexadecimal.

I find a way to memorize it, in anime Inital D, Rotary Brothers drive Mazda RX-7 FC and FD.
those cars are Unique Local
Answer is correct

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of configuring different levels of syslog for different devices on the network?

discussion.content:
What is the purpose of catching a bus?
 Cisco's answer: Walk into the bus.
 Normal people's answer: To arrive the destination.
 
What is the purpose of eating food?
 Cisco's answer: Bite, chew and swallow the food.
 Normal people's answer: To enjoy the taste or provide energy.

Selected Answer: B
B is the PURPOSE of the action.
A is the method, not the purpose.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

By configuring different levels of syslog for different devices, network administrators can prioritize and filter syslog messages based on their severity. 
This allows them to focus on critical issues while reducing the volume of less important messages, thereby facilitating efficient monitoring and troubleshooting of the network.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct
Why not B?

The purpose of configuring different levels of syslog for different devices on the network is to set the severity of syslog messages from each device.

ip helper-address 192.168.20.2

Selected Answer: C
When configuring the ip helper-address command on the switch, you should use the IP address of the router's interface that is directly connected to the subnet where the client devices reside, not the default router IP.:
The ip helper-address command tells the switch (or router) where to forward DHCP requests.

So IP helper-address command must be on the Default-Gateway of our respective VLAN. So in this scenario our host is in VLAN 10 has a pool Created named Net10, we have two DHCP servers created for VLAN 10 and VLAN 20 Net 20 (READ THE commands inserted on R1 not the 192.168.20.2 IP address that you see on the picture , that's a trap ). We can't tell PC 1 get your IP address from DHCP Server on VLAN 20 because then you will have no internet connectivity because the our port F0/1 is in VLAN 10! We need our PC to get a valid IP address from 192.168.10.2 Then it will have connectivity on Port FastEthernet 0/1 access port vlan 10.
Right answer D, 192.168.10.2 THIS is where we want our broadcast Discovery message to go as a UNICAST , to this address, because we have a DHCP server for each VLAN !!!

Ok this going to be long. Correct me if I am wrong please. 1st we have a multilayer switch with interswitch vlan routing going on. 
Ip helper should be applied on the routing interface closest to the clients, because the discover messages cant pass layer 3 interface without ip helper. On the switch we have Interface VLAN 10 192.168.10.1. So any device trying to exit the broadcast domain from vlan 10 has to go thru this interface. So that's where we should apply the IP Helper command on. Then we look for the IP Address of the DHCP Server and it looks like the IP Address of the server is Int g0/0 192.168.20.2. So the correct answer should be SW1(config)int vlan 10 , SW1(config-if)ip helper-address 192.168.20.2
DHCP Network command not configured
